cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift north-northwest toward the South Carolina coast this weekend, then turn north-northeast and track up the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast before moving back offshore south of New England by Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (around Myrtle Beach–Georgetown area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast and Mid-Atlantic shoreline from Georgia through Maine, including Delaware Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a low (≤7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts generally 25–35 mph Monday into early Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–2 ft possible in Delaware Bay during high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday through Tuesday with locally higher amounts in heavy bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas affecting vessel approaches to Delaware Bay beginning this weekend.
